moves.2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 h6: Not so often, but I did see this move before.
moves.4. Nc3 Nf6 5. O-O Bc5 6. d3 a6 7. Re1: Preparing for Be3, I want to eliminate his dark bishop.
moves.7... d6 8. Be3 Bb4 9. a3 Bxc3 10. bxc3: Ok the dark bishop is gone, and also I'm not worried about doubled pawns on c file, because I have plan, how to "fix" that.
moves.10... b5 11. Bb3 Bb7 12. Nd2: I could play d4, but his white bishop stopped me to do that. 12.d4 Nxe4 13.dxe5 Nxe5 14.Nxe5 dxe5, and I'm a pawn down, my dark bishop is locked, and I still have doubled pawns on c file.
moves.12... Ne7 13. c4: Fixing the doubled pawns problem. If 13....b4 then 14.axb4 and a file is open.
moves.14... d5 15. Nxe5 d4: I think Ng6 is the best move here.
moves.21. Rg3: I totally overlooked the next move for black, which is the wining move.
moves.22. f5: And I still didn't see it, to prevent it. I was to busy whit 23.Be6 pinning his Queen to his King.
moves.22... Qd4+: Now here it is. If I move my king to h1, then Nf2+, 24.Kg1 Nxd1+, and the game is lost so I want to resign. But then I did the next move, to offer my opponent a quick finish of the game with well deserved checkmate.
moves.24. Rxe3 Qxe3 25. Qxh5 Qd4 26. Rb1 Qf6 2: And the cards have turned. Now I'm winning.
moves.30. exf6 Nxf5 31. Kg1 Nd4 32. Qf4+ Ka8 3: And my opponent resign and congratulated me for the win. But on move 23 I should congratulated him. Thanks to my opponent escalabar, and good day to all of you.

gameName: The lost game turned in to win
